comments:
Eclipse 3.2M2
At some point during the course of editing my build.properties file for a plugin
project, my bin.includes entry became corrupted (if I can figure out what steps
caused the editor to corrupt it, I'll file that one too).  The line ended up
looking something like:

bin.includes = META-INF/,\
               plugin.xml,\
               icons/,\
               foo/,\
               foo-ui.jar
               icons/,\
               foo/

note the missing ",\" after the entry for foo-ui.jar (and ignore the fact that
there are duplicated entries that were somehow added).  Attempting to open the
file after this error was introduced, results in the following exception:

java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 8
	at java.lang.String.charAt(String.java(Compiled Code))
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.util.PropertiesUtil.windEscapeChars(PropertiesUtil.java:102)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.model.build.Build.adjustOffsets(Build.java:118)

	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.model.build.BuildModel.load(BuildModel.java:47)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.model.AbstractEditingModel.load(AbstractEditingModel.java:110)

Code))

This should probably get handled more gracefully as it did not do a very good
job of pointing me in the direction of the real problem (that my
build.properties file had a syntax error / invalid entry of some kind).
